instruction: Cut fish fillets into bite-sized pieces.
In a shallow dish, combine lime juice, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Add fish and toss to coat evenly. Marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add a thin layer of olive oil (about 1 tablespoon).

Once the oil is hot and shimmering, remove fish from the marinade (letting excess drip off) and add it to the pan. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork.
While the fish cooks, warm corn tortillas according to package instructions (microwave, stovetop, etc.).
Assemble tacos by placing fish in each tortilla. Top with shredded cabbage, chopped cilantro, sliced avocado, and your desired taco toppings (pico de gallo, crema, hot sauce, etc.).
